tweets.html:
This is a fun Stephen Colbert performance, but where's Wayne LaPierre?

— Dave Weigel (@daveweigel) December 21, 2012

BREAKING: Following NRA's path, alcohol industry now blaming drunk driving on "too much Mario Kart"

— Rex Huppke (@RexHuppke) December 21, 2012

If you want the definition of irony, the NRA are shooting themselves in the foot on TV right now...

— Mark Stay (@markstay) December 21, 2012

NRA calls for lawless wasteland where good & evil gunslingers do battle as the lives of our children hang in the balance. Stephen King sues.

— Justin McElroy (@JustinMcElroy) December 21, 2012

It's time the biased liberal media stopped trying to undermine Wayne LaPierre by allowing him to speak uninterrupted on natl TV

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) December 21, 2012

The only way this NRA press conference would make any sense is if someone shouted, "LIVE FROM NEW YORK, IT'S SATURDAY NIGHT!"

— Jenny Johnson (@JennyJohnsonHi5) December 21, 2012

"It's like Star Wars missile defense. But with KIDS !" - Wayne LaPierre's plan to protect kids in school.

— Benari Poulten (@BenariLee) December 21, 2012

Maybe it won't be so bad, in Harry Potter they gave all the students weapons and they did OK.

— MJ (@sucittaM) December 21, 2012

Exact quote just now from the NRA press conference. "This is the beginning of a serious conversation. We won't be taking any questions."

— Jay Rosen (@jayrosen_nyu) December 21, 2012

It is clear...VERY clear that Wayne LaPierre talked to NOT ONE PR Fixer. Olivia Pope would shake her head in shame at this foolishness.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) December 21, 2012

#IfOliviaPopewerereal she would stand behind LaPierre and kick him in the ass whenever he talked ab hurricanes & natl disasters.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) December 21, 2012

@kristenwarner as would Eli Gold. Eli would be having a heart attack, Olivia would be fuming.

— Andrew Kendall (@DepartedAviator) December 21, 2012

"The only thing that stops a bad guy with a gun is a good guy with a gun." Now who's influenced by movies and games?

— Keith Phipps (@kphipps3000) December 21, 2012

"The only thing that stops a bad guy with a gun is a good guy with a gun." @NRA thinks we live in a John Wayne movie.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) December 21, 2012

Can't wait to go see Natural Born Killers this weekend and then go play Mortal Kombat at the Dream Machine. I love being 11.

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) December 21, 2012

How bout just half schools are real schools and half are filled with venomous cobras so it's like a 50/50 chance a bad guy gets bit n dies

— Dan Clyne (@danCLYNE) December 21, 2012

Fanfic roundrobin: Olivia Pope and Eli Gold are hired to help NRA when LaPierre breaks w/the plan and blames hurricanes. What happens next?

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) December 21, 2012

American Psycho doesn't inspire people to go on killing sprees, it inspires them to write mediocre books.

— pilot (@pilotbacon) December 21, 2012

If video games were the problem, every kid in the world would want to be a plumber.

— Brian Lynch (@BrianLynch) December 21, 2012

Just want to point out the NRA's plan to stop school shootings is literally the plot of Kindergarten Cop.

Bravo Christoph Waltz for your portrayal of NRA Exec V.P. Wayne LaPierre. The evil was palpable.

— Nell Scovell (@NellSco) December 21, 2012

I, for one, blame all my moral failings on Myst.

— Ronan Farrow (@RonanFarrow) December 21, 2012

I don't recognize any of the dudes at this N.W.A. press conference.

— me at. (@biorhythmist) December 21, 2012

How long before Wayne LaPierre's record label announces that he'll be duetting with Rayna James to improve his image?

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) December 21, 2012

CSPAN IS REPLAYING THE NRA PRESSER! IT REALLY HAPPENED.

— On a Merry coXmas (@anamariecox) December 21, 2012

Funny how no amount of Hollywood movies has made anyone in America better looking or provided them with snappier repartee.

— On a Merry coXmas (@anamariecox) December 21, 2012

Maybe we could just buy Santa's naughty/nice database to see who can have guns.

— Michael Ian Black (@michaelianblack) December 21, 2012

"Whoa! Slow down! Sir... Can you let me talk, sir?...No, we did NOT hold a press conference today!" - National Restaurant Association

— John Moe (@johnmoe) December 21, 2012

Question: Do Stewart and Colbert have to pay the @NRA royalties for basically writing their jokes for their next show?

— Michael Deneen (@This_Is_Mike_D) December 21, 2012

Like a sibling copying his much older brother's book report, I think the NRA looked up its speech from 1995 and hit "print" this morning.

— Brian Scofield (@fbscofield) December 21, 2012

British news is covering the NRA response to Newtown and has had to clarify twice that what they're showing is not a spoof.

I don't even know why the NBA is getting in on this discussion. They don't shoot baskets with guns, do they?

OK, well what does the WNRA have to say?

Hi @NRA. We played Grand Theft Auto and watched Natural Born Killers (1994!) in the UK. So, erm, maybe find something more gunny to blame?

Breaking: Montreal digital animation students take credit for NRA press conference.

"I suggest putting a teacher in every gun store"

A: More guns

To everyone who ever said CW programming was a sign of the apocalypse, we await your apology.

Dear Black Twitter: You won't get confirmation of Maurice White on TMZ, E!, People etc. because THEY. DON'T. KNOW. WHO. HE. IS. #realtalk

So, this "cute blonde Olympic athlete becomes realtor/high-priced escort" story is pretty much every HBO/Showtime half hour rolled into one.

Hard not to think AMC feels it can get 10m viewers/week no matter who's in charge as long as there are intestines getting ripped.

In Hollywood, you can withdraw "creative differences" at ATMs. MT @Wx_Ben
Was it really "Creative differences," not Mazzara seeking more $?

I have no interest in the show, but I might watch Veena Sud's The Walking Dead just for the laughs.

I've received four different statements from various people about Glen Mazzara leaving #TheWalkingDead. I await Wayne LaPierre's thoughts.

with earlier #MadMen/ #BreakingBad drama & begin to wonder, should slogan change from "Story Matters Here" to "My Way Or the Highway"?

— Mo Ryan (@moryan) December 21, 2012

Breaking my Twitter silence to comment: AMC, WTF?

— Shawn Ryan (@ShawnRyanTV) December 21, 2012

Common knowledge that AMC cut Breaking Bad shorter than it should have been. Now you have creative differences w/ biggest hit's savior?

— Shawn Ryan (@ShawnRyanTV) December 21, 2012

With FX, Showtime, HBO, Starz, Cinemax, A&E, TNT and others to sell to, it's a real question now why good show runners should sell to AMC?

— Shawn Ryan (@ShawnRyanTV) December 21, 2012

I don't quite understand AMCs new antishowrunner policies.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) December 21, 2012

It's kind of exciting to watch a network with new creative cache just screw everything up in real time. Usually you have to read books!

— Julie Hammerle🔨 (@JulieHammerle) December 21, 2012

If your network starts with A and ends with C you probably made a weird decision today.

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) December 21, 2012

Wouldn't be an AMC renewal without a replaced showrunner. Except for Veena Sud, that is, she's a keeper!

— ultralight meme (@GDS3000) December 21, 2012

Vince Gilligan found under desk, tears, trembling,mumbling "shit now I gotta figure out how to END this bitch" as world remains in tact

RIP Leverage (the show, not the idea of competing forces)

CBS Is Never Ever Going To Let Me Meet Your Mother. Like Ever. #HIMYMretitled
